[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/block-executor/src/combinatorial_tests/group_tests.rs] [Cross-function: Error propagation] Does assert_parallel_output properly validate all error cases, or could certain error types be treated as success, hiding critical failures in production execution? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/block-executor/src/combinatorial_tests/group_tests.rs] [Cross-function: State consistency] If parallel execution produces incorrect results that happen to match the baseline (both wrong), would tests catch this, or could systematic bugs go undetected? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/block-executor/src/combinatorial_tests/group_tests.rs] [Cross-function: Gas metering] Are gas calculations deterministic between parallel and sequential execution, or could gas metering differences cause state divergence that breaks consensus? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/block-executor/src/combinatorial_tests/group_tests.rs] [Cross-function: Transaction ordering] Do tests verify that transaction execution order is preserved in parallel execution, or could reordering cause double-spending or other security issues? (Critical)
